forumNotes.author: online
forumNotes.content:
> with hitachi it does work but than he doesn't see the stick as a fixed usb but only as local drive...
Please, note that "Local Disk" just coincides as Fixed Disk (at least under Windows). ![:lol:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/laugh.png)  

Also, note that some tools (just as PeToUSB) are able to format your drive with only 1 partition.  
For PeToUSB if it is a removable drive or a fixed drive then it is not matter, but other utilities need a Removable drive.  
So, if you need more than 1 partition then you can use (under XP) just Disk Management Console (with Hitachi Microdrive Filter Driver or DummyDisk Filter Driver) in order both to partition and to format your drive.  

Try to check this topic too  
[http://www.boot-land...?...ost\&p=62682](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?s=&showtopic=7466&view=findpost&p=62682 "External link")  
and if you find interesting things about your "issue" then let know your results.
